nonogram module

class nonogram.Nonogram(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Nonogram class, used to store nonogram data.

Parameters:

**kwargs – See below

Keyword Arguments:

  • path (str) – Path to nonogram file (.non) or directory with nonogram files

check_all() → bool[source]

Checks if all rows and columns are solved.

Returns:

True if all rows and columns are solved, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

check_col(x: int) → bool[source]

Checks if a column is solved.

Parameters:

x (int) – x coordinate of column

Returns:

True if column is solved, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

check_row(y: int) → bool[source]

Checks if a row is solved.

Parameters:

y (int) – y coordinate of row

Returns:

True if row is solved, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

is_solved() → bool[source]

Is nonogram solved.

Returns:

True if nonogram is solved, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

load(path: str | None = None) → None[source]

Loads a nonogram from a file.

Parameters:

path (Optional[str]) – Path to nonogram file (.non)

Raises:

  • Exception – Invalid path when path is neither file nor directory.

  • Exception – When path and self.path are None.

  • Exception – Invalid path type when path is not a file.

  • Exception – Invalid file format when file does not end with (.non)

  • Exception – Invalid file format when file does not have 9 lines.

load_grid() → None[source]

Loads the nonogram grid object.

Raises:

Exception – Nonogram not loaded.

load_random(path: str | None) → None[source]

Loads a random nonogram from a directory.

Parameters:

path (Optional[str]) – Path to directory with nonogram files (.non)

Raises:

  • Exception – Invalid path when path is neither file nor directory.

  • Exception – When path and self.path are None.

  • Exception – Invalid path type when path is not a directory.

load_solution() → None[source]

Loads solution from nonogram file at self.path.

Raises:

  • Exception – Nonogram not loaded.

  • Exception – Nonogram is not solved or has no solution.

print() → None[source]

Prints the nonogram to the console.

Raises:

Exception – Nonogram not loaded.

save_solution() → None[source]

Saves current grid state as solution in nonogram file at self.path.

Raises:

  • Exception – When path and self.path are None.

  • Exception – Invalid path type when path is not a file.

  • RuntimeError – _description_
